thread.section_title: New York High School Sports Headlines
thread.title: iS8/NIKE: First Round Action

title: iS8/NIKE: First Round Action
text: Talk about it in the nychoops Message Boards SOUTH JAMAICA, NY - Friday marked the first round of the iS8/NIKE Tip-Off Classic playoffs. Two games took place as the stakes were raised to do-or-die status. Two teams advanced while two others went fishing. J.Y.O. KO's HS for Construction, 85-73 The score would be tight throughout most of the first quarter but with 3 minutes remaining, Aaron Walker sparked J.Y.O. to a 14-11 lead with a trey. Amiri White increased the lead as Construction continuously misfired. With 1:30, the J.Y.O. advantage increased to ten points as Rashond Salnave drained a three-ball. Wes Nelson Jr. '16 ended Construction's drought but J.Y.O. remained ahead, 23-15 to end the warm-up quarter.Construction inched closer as Bryshon Bryant closed the gap to 6 but Salnave hit back-to-back three-bombs to extend J.Y.O.'s lead to 29-17. The scoreboard got stuck on 17 for Construction as J.Y.O. continued to run up to a 16 point lead.Nelson was Construction's primary offensive option and did what he could to prevent the game from reaching blow out status. Marcus St. Fucey '16 chimed in and pulled Construction to within 13 points with 4 minute left until halftime.A steal and a pass from Adonis Fishburn '18 to Marice Normil followed by a basket by Fishburn, sliced the J.Y.O. lead to 37-26. With 2:03, the score was 39-28. Construction had a chance to narrow the lead but missed freethrows left them in a 44-33 hole at the midway point.Construction entered the second half dead set on making a run. Nelson, St. Fucey and Jordan Wright '16 quickly closed the gap to 44-42 with perimeter shots before J.Y.O. could regain consciousness. When J.Y.O. finally woke up, Salnave attacked the paint and got to the line to help J.Y.O. push its point spread to 48-42 and soon the Monmouth commit's jumper amped up. An up-tempo pace defined the beginning of the fourth quarter which favored J.Y.O. as their lead launched to 67-52 early. Construction tried to counter but Walker was having his way down the lane. With 5:50 a Walker layup and jumper put J.Y.O. up by 23 points.J.Y.O. went to its bench early and Construction took advantage, quickly cutting its deficit 76-62. With 3 minutes 78-62. A three from the top of the key by 5 and and a bucket with 2:36. 78-69 with 2:05. Coach Billy Medley quickly subbed his starters back in. Walker and Salnave put up points to increase lead back to 11 and would hold on to advance.Walker pumped in 31 points for J.Y.O. with Salnave adding 20 points. Nelson scored 19 points for Construction with Fishburn contributing 18 points Ben Gordon Allstars steamroll Team Long Island, 74-57 The final game of the evening featured a team from Long Island versus the Ben Gordon Allstars (Mt. Vernon). Both teams exchanged buckets early but Ben Gordon Allstars began to gain steam as Jason Stanley-Douglas scored from the arc and the corner plus facilitated. Ben Gordon Allstars jumped out to an 18-4 lead.Team Long Island could not find points until Darien Jenkins (Deer Park '17) drew a foul and hit a free throw. The Ben Gordon Allstars train kept running. A missed heat check by Stanley-Douglas allowed Steve Torre (Kellenberg '16) to notch two more points for Team Long Island with 1:35. Alex Sorensen (South Side '16) cut the lead to 12 with 35 seconds and 22-10 after 1 quarter.Ben Gordon Allstars relaxed a bit defensively. Kyle DeVerna (Kellenberg '16) netted a three pointer. 26-27 Ben Gordon Allstars. Jenkins closed the gap with 5:10 to 26-19. With Ben Gordon Allstars now only holding a 7 point lead, coach Garee Bryant called a time out to regroup.Immediately thereafter, Greg Calixte '16 scores off a curl to the hoop. Jenkins would counter with 2:50 but 4 responded for Ben Gordon Allstars.32-25 with 1 minute left in the half as Stanley-Douglas banged another trey but Team Long Island responded. Ben Gordon Allstars was ahead 35-27 at the half.Team Long Island further closed the gap as Torre scored with 5:43. 39-34 Ben Gordon Allstars. Andre Morgan scored inside and the lead was down to 39-36 before Calixte and 3 put Ben Gordon Allstars up 44-36 with 4 minutes. Shane Gatling (Baldwin '16) kept Team Long Island knocking at the door, down 46-40 with 3 minutes. Jenkins cut lead to 47-43 and Ben Gordon Allstars turned it over with 55 seconds. It was suddenly a close game as Team Long Island was only down, 47-43 at the end of third quarter. Marco Morency '17 spearheaded a Ben Gordon Allstars run that put them up, 56-43 with 5:30. Defense by Calixte helped to vault Ben Gordon Allstars ahead 58-43 before Team Long Island scored with 3:50.Team Long Island began to get desperate but the point spread could not be closed. The Ben Gordon Allstars would advance Stanley-Douglas led the way for Ben Gordon with 18 points with Morency pitching in 16 points. Gatling and Jenkins scored 14 point and 13 points respectively for Team Long Island. FEATURED PRODUCT
